page.title: 07Historic Buildings of Rye
page.content: {Ypres tower:}this used to be a prison, but in 1954 it was opened as a museum. It was built in 1250. {The Mermaid Inn:}this is the most famous hotel in Rye. The most famous smuggling groups stayed there. It is filled with low beams and secret passages. {Lamb House:}this was built in 1720. It belongs to the National Trust, and it is opened to the public. It is famous because Henry James lived there. {Friars of the Sack:}this is where the monks used to live. It is in Church Square. It is the oldest building in Rye.{ {The Customs House:}this has a crooked chimney and cellars below. {Landgate:}this is the only surviving one of the four original gates into Rye. It was built in 1329.
